meanings.definition: Existing or occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The two clocks showed synchronic times.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved in synchronic harmony.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers performed a synchronic routine.
meanings.sent4: Their thoughts were synchronic, like a shared heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The synchronic colors of the sunset painted the sky.

meanings.definition: Relating to the study of a language at a particular point in time, without considering its historical development.
meanings.sent1: The linguist focused on synchronic aspects of the language.
meanings.sent2: The synchronic analysis revealed interesting patterns.
meanings.sent3: The grammar lesson turned into a synchronic comedy show.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a synchronic impact on his understanding.
meanings.sent5: The synchronic language study opened new perspectives.
